name: Alive
desc: This item moves about on its own when not in use. It might mysteriously reappear in its user's possession if they lose or discard it.

name: Attracting
desc: This item tends to attract certain types of animals or supernatural creatures.

name: Covetous
desc: The item’s bearer becomes obsessed with material wealth.

name: Coveted
desc: This item is highly sought after. Others may offer to buy the item from its user at a high price, or more likely attempt to kill them and take it.

name: Damaged
desc: This item is a broken shadow of its former self. It may be possible to repair it.

name: Emotional
desc: This item enhances or suppresses the emotions of its user.

name: Frail
desc: The item crumbles, frays, chips, or cracks slightly when wielded, worn, or activated. This quirk has no effect on its properties, but if the item has seen much use, it looks decrepit.

name: Hungry
desc: This item’s magical properties function only if fresh blood from a humanoid has been applied to it within the past 24 hours. It needs only a drop to activate.

name: Hungry
desc: This item requires "food" of some kind (most likely blood), and will not function if not fed.

name: Loud
desc: The item makes a loud noise—such as a clang, a shout, or a resonating gong—when used.

name: Mark
desc: When used, this item leaves a visible and recognizable mark on its target or the surrounding terrain.

name: Memories
desc: This item contains fragments of memory from its creator or previous user(s). While using it, attuned to it, or sleeping near it, its user might be able to access these memories, or they might see them in brief flashes.

name: Metamorphic
desc: The item periodically and randomly alters its appearance in slight ways. The bearer has no control over these minor alterations, which have no effect on the item’s use.

name: Musical
desc: When used, this item plays a song or song fragment.

name: Noisy
desc: This item makes a loud noise when used.

name: Painful
desc: The bearer experiences a harmless flash of pain when using the item.

name: Possessive
desc: The item demands attunement when first wielded or worn, and it doesn’t allow its bearer to attune to other items. (Other items already attuned to the bearer remain so until their attunement ends.)

name: Repulsive
desc: The bearer feels a sense of distaste when in contact with the item, and continues to sense discomfort while bearing it.

name: Sentient
desc: This item is alive and can speak to its user or others. It has some amount of control over how it is used and may be able to reject users it deems unfit.

name: Slothful
desc: The bearer of this item feels slothful and lethargic. While attuned to the item, the bearer requires 10 hours to finish a long rest.

name: Testing
desc: This item will test any potential user to determine if they are worthy of it.

name: Worn
desc: This item is worn from lack of use, but will regain its power the more it is used.
